intro: Dianthera setacea, commonly known as the hairy bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, hairy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered with fine, soft hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Dianthera setacea is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its delicate and attractive blooms.
